meanings.definition: The part of the alimentary canal that extends from the mouth and nasal cavities to the larynx.
meanings.sent1: Food travels through our pharynxes on its way to the stomach.
meanings.sent2: Doctors examine patients' pharynxes to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The pharynxes of the body are like a busy highway for food traffic.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice flowed smoothly through her pharynxes, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The pharynxes, like a bridge, connect the mouth and the larynx in the body.

meanings.sent1: In anatomy class, we learned about the different pharynxes in the human body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed out the pharynxes in the diagram of the throat.
meanings.sent3: The pharynxes in the model looked like tiny tunnels leading to the larynx.
meanings.sent4: The pharynxes of the choir members harmonized beautifully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The pharynxes, when healthy, ensure smooth passage of food and air in the body.
